definitions.definition: easy to perceive, understand, or interpret.
examples: the voice on the telephone was clear and strong

definitions.definition: leaving no doubt; obvious or unambiguous.
examples: it was clear that they were in a trap
synonyms: as plain as the nose on one's face "a clear case of harassment"

definitions.definition: having or feeling no doubt or confusion.
examples: every student must be clear about what is expected

definitions.definition: (of a substance) transparent.
examples: the clear glass of the French windows

definitions.definition: free of cloud, mist, or rain.
examples: the day was fine and clear
synonyms: without a cloud in the sky "a clear blue sky"

definitions.definition: (of a person's skin) free from blemishes.
examples: unblemished, spot-free her clear complexion

definitions.definition: (of a person's eyes) unclouded; shining.
examples: I looked into her clear gray eyes

definitions.definition: (of a color) pure and intense.
examples: clear blue delphiniums

definitions.definition: (of a fire) burning with little smoke.
examples: a bright, clear flame

definitions.definition: free of any obstructions or unwanted objects.
examples: with a clear road ahead, he shifted into high gear

definitions.definition: (of a period of time) free of any appointments or commitments.
examples: the following Saturday Mattie had a clear day

definitions.definition: (of a person) free of something undesirable or unpleasant.
examples: after 18 months of treatment he was clear of TB

definitions.definition: (of a person's mind) free of something that impairs logical thought.
examples: in the morning, with a clear head, she would tackle all her problems

definitions.definition: (of a person's conscience) free of guilt.
examples: untroubled, undisturbed, unperturbed, unconcerned, having no qualms; Morepeaceful, at peace, tranquil, serene, calm, easy "a clear conscience"Morepeaceful, at peace, tranquil, serene, calm, easy a clear conscience

definitions.definition: not touching; away from.
examples: the truck was wedged in the ditch, one wheel clear of the ground

definitions.definition: (of a sum of money) net.
examples: a clear profit of $1,100

definitions.definition: denoting a palatalized form of l (as in salad or willing ) in some southern US accents or as in leaf in Irish accents.
so as to be out of the way of or away from.
examples: he leapt clear of the car
synonyms: out of contact with "stand clear of the doors"

definitions.definition: so as not to be obstructed or cluttered.
examples: the floor had been swept clear of litter

definitions.definition: completely.
examples: he had time to get clear away
synonyms: utterly; informalclean "he has time to get clear away"

definitions.definition: all the way to.
examples: you could see clear to the bottom of the lagoon
